medical_history.chief_complaint: Five female patients presented with hypercalcemia and elevated PTH levels.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patients were diagnosed with pseudohypoparathyroidism between the ages of 12 and 20. Symptoms of hypocalcemia, including seizures, tetany, and cramps, were noted, initially treated with calcium and vitamin D. After 21 to 42 years post-diagnosis, patients developed hypercalcemia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Pseudohypoparathyroidism type 1B (PHP1B) with loss of GNAS exon 1A methylation; some had STX16 deletion mutation.
medical_history.family_history: Two patients had a strong family history of hypocalcemia including mothers and siblings with PHP1B.
